title: Photos: Atlanta house fire
text:
1 / 17
John Spink Homicide and arson investigators are looking into a suspicious overnight house fire in northwest Atlanta left two people dead.
2 / 17
John Spink Agents with the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms remained at the burned out house on Jett Street in the Vine City community early Tuesday afternoon.
3 / 17
John Spink Five people were inside the home when it caught fire, and a man and woman were unable to escape.
4 / 17
John Spink Arriving fire crews found the house fully involved in flames.
5 / 17
John Spink “Most of the fire was on the front side of the house, which prevented [firefighters] from going in the front door,” Atlanta fire spokesman Cortez Stafford told The Atlanta Journal-Constitution.
6 / 17
John Spink One of the three people who escaped the fire told Channel 2 Action News that his uncle and the woman killed were in an argument with someone at the front door just before the fire broke out.
7 / 17
John Spink “This fire is being reported as suspicious due to some of the statements of people that were here,” Stafford said.
8 / 17
John Spink The names of the man and woman killed were not available Tuesday afternoon.
9 / 17
John Spink
10 / 17
John Spink
11 / 17
John Spink
12 / 17
John Spink
